statements.name: PROC DBCSTAB
statements.description: Produces conversion tables for double-byte character sets.

arguments.name: TABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the double-byte code table to produce. This table name becomes an entry of type DBCSTAB in the catalog that is specified with the CATALOG= option. By default, the catalog name is Sasuser.DBCS.

arguments.name: BASETYPE=
arguments.description: specifies a base type for the double-byte code table conversion. If you use this option, you reduce the number of tables that are produced.

arguments.name: CATALOG=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the catalog in which the table is stored. If the catalog does not exist, it is created.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies the data for producing the double-byte code table. Several double-byte character variables are required to produce the table. Use variable names that are equivalent to the value of the DBCSTYPE= system option and recognized by the KCVT function.

arguments.name: DBCSLANG=
arguments.description: specifies the language that the double-byte code table uses. The value of this option should match the value of the DBCSLANG= system option.

arguments.name: DESC=
arguments.description: specifies a text string to put in the DESCRIPTION field for the entry.

arguments.name: FORCE
arguments.description: produces the conversion tables, even if errors are present.

arguments.name: VERIFY
arguments.description: checks the data range of the input table based on the code. This option checks for invalid double-byte code.

arguments.name: VERBOSE
arguments.description: prints the statistics detail when building DBCS tables.
